intro: Blysmus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Blysmus species are typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. The flowers are small and clustered, forming dense inflorescences that are often wind-pollinated. These plants are adapted to withstand drought conditions and play a role in stabilizing soil in their native habitats.
